Description.val:
This line item funds multiple modifications that apply to weapon systems funded at less than $2 million per year as well as weapon systems with much greater budgets.  The overall goal of the modifications budgeted is to enhance capability and improve reliability and maintainability.  

Funding contained in this platform's documentation directly aids simulator aircraft training systems training enterprise to continue its overall FYDP pilot production increase thus reducing the USAF Pilot Shortage.

FY 2019-FY 2023 funding for PE 0207701F, Full Combat Mission Training, Mod 8669, efforts were transferred to PE 0207133F, F-16, in order to transfer programmatic responsibilities and funding to the F-16 weapon system team.

Funding may be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues. 

FY17 funding totals include $7.5M for Overseas Contingency Operations.

FY19 funding totals include $29.2M for Overseas Contingency Operations. PE 0207249($22M ATP & Upgrades; $7.2M ATP Digital Video). PE 0207701F $10.010M for threat simulators for Nellis AFB Virtual Test Training Range.

Funding for this exhibit contained in PE 0207224F, 0207249F, 0303601F, 0401897F.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense mission, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civilian authorities.

Justification.val: Where applicable, justification for individual modifications is provided in the P-3A exhibits.

Description.val:
The LITENING and Sniper ATP contracts will address requirements centered on new capability as well as hardware and software upgrades necessary to align with the most current pod configuration.  This would include host platform integration and test, modification of spares, correction of service life deficiencies, technical orders, repair data, studies, support of depot repair requirements and all modifications necessary to capitalize on the most current required capability.  In addition, this requirement provides for program management support.  Funds may be used to address emerging and short-notice Diminishing Manufacturing Sources and Material Shortages (DMSMS) issues.

Quantities will vary based on funding, negotiated prices and COCOM requirements.

Milestone/Development Status

Milestone/Development Status

Legacy will incorporate SE capabilities already developed through the SE contract.

This effort improves the critical capability of Combat Identification (CID) by adding the radio-based CID (RBCI) technology. The LITENING and Sniper ATP contracts will address requirements centered on hardware and software upgrades and associated host platform integration (to include necessary test), modification of spares, correction of service life deficiencies, technical orders, repair data, studies and support of organic depot repair requirements. Modification of legacy pods to ATP-SE standards may be necessary for modifications. In addition, this requirement provides for program management support. Quantities will vary based on negotiated prices. Funds may be used to address emerging and short-notice Diminishing Manufacturing and Material Shortage (DMSMS) issues.

Milestone/Development Status

Upgrades will incorporate capabilities developed by industry and through the SE contract.

Title.val: CONUS Base Aircraft Support Equipment and Spares

Name.val: CONUS Base Aircraft Support Equipment and Spares:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)
Ground Unit Integration:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)
Prototype E-11 Modification:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)

Description.val:
This program, P-3A Mod 8733, Battlefield ABN Comm Node (BACN), is a new start.
Battlefield Airborne Communication Node (BACN) provides a Combatant Commander (CCDR) flexible, long-endurance, responsive airborne communications capability in permissive to contested environments. BACN provides a dedicated airborne capability to conduct voice bridging/translation, Tactical Data Link (TDL) gateway, and TDL relay functions for beyond-line-of-sight (BLOS) data communications.

Milestone/Development Status

The program is currently in the Operations and Support (O&S) Phase of the Life Cycle Management System. FY19 will start the transition from an OCO funded program to a baseline funded program. BACN includes the payload, its host platforms (4 E-11A and 3 EQ-4B)and associated ground systems. 
Funding will be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues. Funding will also be used for fulfillment of requirements in support of alteration, conversion, modernization or transition to a normalized program (PoR). This may include modifications required for enhanced capability and improvements to system reliability and maintainability.

Location.val: 9326 Spectrum Center Blvd, San Diego, CA 92123

Description.val:
Roll-on Beyond-Line-of-Sight Enhancement (ROBE) is a beyond line-of-sight (BLOS) gateway and force multiplier enabling decision makers to leverage decision-quality information to increase predictive battlespace awareness, shorten the Find, Fix, Track, Target, Engage, Assess (F2T2EA) decision cycle, facilitate precision attack and compress the sensor to shooter kill chain. It provides a robust, secure means to exchange Link 16 and Situation Awareness Data Link (SADL) Line-of-Sight (LOS) to BLOS recipients. 40 KC-135 aircraft are currently modified with ROBE A Kits in the combat theater and 20 ROBE B Kits are fielded and in the inventory. 

ROBE is an ancillary capability with the aerial refueling mission. ROBE is a high demand asset supporting Joint Warfighters in the combat theater and has proven a valuable asset to geographically separated ground and airborne assets - specifically, special operations, troops in contact and strike/targeting missions. 

This line item funds the procurement of additional ROBE B kits due to increasing Tactical Data Link mission requirements. Additionally, this line item may be used in fulfillment of requirements in support of alteration, conversion, modernization or service life extension efforts for the ROBE system.  Modifications required for enhanced capability and improvements to system reliability and maintainability are included. Funding may be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues.

Milestone/Development Status

Initial Operational Capability (IOC) for ROBE was declared April 2006. 

ROBE is currently in the Operations and Support (O&S) Phase of the Life Cycle Management System. 

All development activities to support ROBE Spiral 2 KC-135 integration were completed. 40 KC-135 aircraft were modified with ROBE Spiral 2 A Kit hardware and 20 ROBE Spiral 2 B Kits were fielded.

All development activities to support ROBE Spiral 3 B Kit Tech Refresh were completed. Upon receipt of the 605 Test Evaluation Squadron (TES) fielding recommendation and Authority to Operate (ATO),  fielding of those kits will begin.
